page.title: 01Mickfield Farmland/Village
page.content: The area is mainly arable farmland, mostly owned by large concerns who have destroyed many hedges turning the land into semi prairie. There is a small village with the properties largely clustered around crossroads near a redundant Church of England Church. There are 7 post war houses and also 8 between wars council houses, otherwise mainly cottages of various types. Outside the centre the housing is farmhouses and cottages. A few inhabitants work on the and, others commute to Ipswich (12 miles) and other surrounding towns and village and also the small light industrial area on the disused wartime airfield. The Electoral Roll has 106 names. The main Ipswich/Norwich Road runs along the Western boudary of the area. The only remaining amenities are a
